resources.string: Give us the following info and we’ll quickly review your car to decide if it’s a fit for Cars & Bids. If your car is accepted, we’ll ask for more details and photos, collect the listing fee, and work with you to get the auction live.
Is this car for sale elsewhere?
Is the title in your name?
Do you want to sell a minimum price required for your vehicle to sell?
How did you hear about us? If a user referred, please leave their username
Is there a lienholder on the title?
Are there any additional fees the buyer will have to pay? If so, what are they?
If we accept your car, all other listings will need to be taken down before it can be listed on our site
Please link to all existing listings
What has been modified on the vehicle?
Who\'s name is on the title?
What reserve price would you like (USD)?
* Please select dealer or private party
* Please select if car is sold elsewhere
* Please submit no more than 16 photos

\t\tAuction you modern enthusiast or cool car — anything from the 1980s to now. \n \n\t\tTo us, \"cool\" ranges from the obvious (Ferraris, Lamborghinis, Aston Martin, etc.) to the esoteric (a pristine Dodge Dakota Convertible or a Mercury Capri XR2) to the traditional fun cars that enthusiasts love (a Mazda MX-5 Miata or a Porsche 911). Basically, if it\'s exciting, fun, interesting, or quirky and it is from the modern era, it is welcome here on Cars & Bids.

\t\tBuyers pay a 4.5% commission, capped at $4,500. Seller listing fee starts at $49. \n\n \t\tThe buyer\'s fee is a minimum of \$225 and a maximum of \$4,500. The seller\'s fee is \$49 for a no-reserve auction or repeat seller and \$89 for a first-time seller with a reserve auction.

\t\tWe provide free vehicle history reports for every vehicle listed. We believe every vehicle should come with a vehicle history report, so we provide one for free, instead of having the sellers pay for their own.

\t\tWe\'ve developed several new features that innovate buying and selling enthusiast cars online. \n\n \t\tFrom making it so a seller only needs to provide crucial information when applying to sell, to simplified sorting and searching when buying, to quickly getting cars up for auction; Cars & Bids offers an easy-to-use car auction platform.

\t\tDoug Demuro brings his years of experience in the car industry to Cars & Bids. \n\n\t\tFrom his successful YouTube channel reviewing cars to his time before that doing. Doug has built a large car enthusiast platform that he now brings to Cars & Bids. Periodically, Doug will review cars offered on Cars & Bids which would bring many more eyes to a listing.

Summary: \n
Account required to make a bid. \n
Can contact seller both privately and publicly. \n
Once a bid is placed, we hold 4.5% of bid on your credit card. \n
If a bid is placed within a minute left of auction ending, timer reset to 1 minute. \n
Once auction complete, we take the 4.5% commission from winning bidder and release the hold from all other bidders. \n
We will send the winning bidder the seller\'s contact information so the remaining details and transactions can be completed. \n
If highest bid does not meet reserve, we will talk to seller and highest bidder to try and make it work. We will even take a 2.5% commission fee instead of 4.5%.

Summary: \n
Account required to fill out form. \n
After completing the submission form we will review it and if accepted, we will let you know via email! \n
Follow the link in the email to provide more information and more photos. \n
Once we get all your information, we will make your listing and send it to you for approval. \n
If you do approve, then we will figure out a good time to post your car, where it will be for sale for 7 days. \n
During those 7 days, we strongly encourage every seller to keep up with the conversation about your vehicle. Respond to questions, comments, etc., because doing so increases chances of getting the most money possible for your car. \n
Once the auction is done, we will send the seller the winning bidder\'s contact information so the remaining details and transactions can be completed. \n
If the auction closes without a sale, we will communicate with the seller and highest bidder to try to work out a deal.
